contract"},"backupOracle()":{"notice":"the backup oracle reference by the contract"},"buffer()":{"notice":"the amount of action used before hitting limit"},"bufferCap()":{"notice":"the cap of the buffer that can be used at once"},"bufferStored()":{"notice":"the buffer at the timestamp of lastBufferUsedTime"},"constructor":{"notice":"construct the non custodial PSM. Structs are used to prevent stack too deep errors"},"core()":{"notice":"address of the Core contract referenced"},"decimalsNormalizer()":{"notice":"number of decimals to scale oracle price by, i.e. multiplying by 10^(decimalsNormalizer)"},"doPartialAction()":{"notice":"a flag for whether to allow partial actions to complete if the buffer is less than amount"},"getMaxMintAmountOut()":{"notice":"getter to return the maximum amount of VOLT that could be purchased at once"},"getMintAmountOut(uint256)":{"notice":"calculate the amount of VOLT out for a given `amountIn` of underlying First get oracle price of token Then figure out how many dollars that amount in is worth by multiplying price * amount. ensure decimals are normalized if on underlying they are not 18"},"getRedeemAmountOut(uint256)":{"notice":"calculate the amount of underlying out for a given `amountVoltIn` of VOLT First get oracle price of token Then figure out how many dollars that amount in is worth by multiplying price * amount. ensure decimals are normalized if on underlying they are not 18"},"invert((uint256))":{"notice":"invert a peg price"},"isContractAdmin(address)":{"notice":"returns whether a given address has the admin role for this contract"},"lastBufferUsedTime()":{"notice":"the last time the buffer was used by the contract"},"mint(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"function to buy VOLT for an underlying asset that is pegged to $1 We first transfer any contract-owned VOLT, then mint the remaining if necessary This function will replenish the buffer based on the amount of VOLT that is being sent out."},"mintFeeBasisPoints()":{"notice":"the fee in basis points for selling an asset into VOLT"},"mintPaused()":{"notice":"boolean switch that indicates whether minting is paused"},"oracle()":{"notice":"the oracle reference by the contract"},"pause()":{"notice":"set pausable methods to paused"},"pauseMint()":{"notice":"set secondary pausable methods to paused"},"pauseRedeem()":{"notice":"set secondary pausable methods to paused"},"pcvDeposit()":{"notice":"the PCV deposit target to deposit and withdraw from"},"rateLimitPerSecond()":{"notice":"the rate per second for this contract"},"rateLimitedMinter()":{"notice":"Rate Limited Minter contract that will be called when VOLT needs to be minted"},"readOracle()":{"notice":"the peg price of the referenced oracle"},"redeem(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"function to redeem VOLT for an underlying asset We do not burn VOLT; this allows the contract's balance of VOLT to be used before the buffer is used In practice, this helps prevent artificial cycling of mint-burn cycles and prevents DOS attacks. This function will deplete the buffer based on the amount of VOLT that is being redeemed."},"redeemFeeBasisPoints()":{"notice":"the fee in basis points for buying the asset for VOLT"},"redeemPaused()":{"notice":"boolean switch that indicates whether redeeming is paused"},"setBackupOracle(address)":{"notice":"sets the referenced backup oracle"},"setBufferCap(uint256)":{"notice":"set the buffer cap"},"setContractAdminRole(bytes32)":{"notice":"sets a new admin role for this contract"},"setDecimalsNormalizer(int256)":{"notice":"sets the new decimalsNormalizer"},"setDoInvert(bool)":{"notice":"sets the flag for whether to invert or not"},"setGlobalRateLimitedMinter(address)":{"notice":"set the target to call for VOLT minting"},"setMintFee(uint256)":{"notice":"set the mint fee vs oracle price in basis point terms"},"setOracle(address)":{"notice":"sets the referenced oracle"},"setPCVDeposit(address)":{"notice":"set the target for sending all PCV"},"setRateLimitPerSecond(uint256)":{"notice":"set the rate limit per second"},"setRedeemFee(uint256)":{"notice":"set the redemption fee vs oracle price in basis point terms"},"underlyingToken()":{"notice":"the token this PSM will exchange for VOLT Must be a stable token pegged to $1"},"unpause()":{"notice":"set pausable methods to unpaused"},"unpauseMint()":{"notice":"set secondary pausable methods to unpaused"},"unpauseRedeem()":{"notice":"set secondary pausable methods to unpaused"},"updateOracle()":{"notice":"updates the referenced oracle"},"vcon()":{"notice":"address of the Tribe contract referenced by Core"},"vconBalance()":{"notice":"vcon balance of contract"},"volt()":{"notice":"address of the Fei contract referenced by Core"},"voltBalance()":{"notice":"volt balance of contract"},"withdrawERC20(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"withdraw ERC20 from the contract"}},"notice":"Peg Stability Module that holds no funds. On a mint, it transfers all proceeds to a PCV Deposit When funds are needed for a redemption, they are simply pulled from the PCV buffer().details: replenishes at rateLimitPerSecond per second up to bufferCap

returns._0: the maximum amount of VOLT available for purchase at once through this PSM

params.amountIn: the amount of external asset to sell to the PSM

returns.amountVoltOut: the amount of VOLT received for the amountIn of external asset

params.amountVoltIn: the amount of VOLT to redeem

returns.amountTokenOut: the amount of the external asset received in exchange for the amount of VOLT redeemed

invert((uint256)).details: the inverted peg would be X per FEI

returns._0: the inverted peg as a Decimal

params.amountIn: the amount of external asset to sell to the PSM
params.minVoltAmountOut: the minimum amount of VOLT out otherwise the TX will fail

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

readOracle().details: the peg is defined as FEI per X with X being ETH, dollars, etc

params.amountVoltIn: the amount of VOLT to sell
params.minAmountOut: the minimum amount out otherwise the TX will fail

params.newBackupOracle: the new backup oracle to reference

params.newDoInvert: the new flag for whether to invert

params.newMinter: new Global Rate Limited Minter for this PSM

params.newMintFeeBasisPoints: the new fee in basis points for minting

params.newTarget: new PCV Deposit target for this PSM

params.newRedeemFeeBasisPoints: the new fee in basis points for redemptions

params.token: address of the ERC20 to send

CONTRACT_ADMIN_ROLE().notice: a role used with a subset of governor permissions for this contract only

MAX_FEE().notice: the max mint and redeem fee in basis points Governance cannot change the maximum fee

MAX_RATE_LIMIT_PER_SECOND().notice: maximum rate limit per second governance can set for this contract

backupOracle().notice: the backup oracle reference by the contract

buffer().notice: the amount of action used before hitting limit

bufferCap().notice: the cap of the buffer that can be used at once

bufferStored().notice: the buffer at the timestamp of lastBufferUsedTime

constructor.notice: construct the non custodial PSM. Structs are used to prevent stack too deep errors

core().notice: address of the Core contract referenced

decimalsNormalizer().notice: number of decimals to scale oracle price by, i.e. multiplying by 10^(decimalsNormalizer)

doPartialAction().notice: a flag for whether to allow partial actions to complete if the buffer is less than amount

getMaxMintAmountOut().notice: getter to return the maximum amount of VOLT that could be purchased at once

getMintAmountOut(uint256).notice: calculate the amount of VOLT out for a given `amountIn` of underlying First get oracle price of token Then figure out how many dollars that amount in is worth by multiplying price * amount. ensure decimals are normalized if on underlying they are not 18

getRedeemAmountOut(uint256).notice: calculate the amount of underlying out for a given `amountVoltIn` of VOLT First get oracle price of token Then figure out how many dollars that amount in is worth by multiplying price * amount. ensure decimals are normalized if on underlying they are not 18

isContractAdmin(address).notice: returns whether a given address has the admin role for this contract

lastBufferUsedTime().notice: the last time the buffer was used by the contract

mint(address,uint256,uint256).notice: function to buy VOLT for an underlying asset that is pegged to $1 We first transfer any contract-owned VOLT, then mint the remaining if necessary This function will replenish the buffer based on the amount of VOLT that is being sent out.

mintFeeBasisPoints().notice: the fee in basis points for selling an asset into VOLT

mintPaused().notice: boolean switch that indicates whether minting is paused

oracle().notice: the oracle reference by the contract

pauseMint().notice: set secondary pausable methods to paused

pauseRedeem().notice: set secondary pausable methods to paused

pcvDeposit().notice: the PCV deposit target to deposit and withdraw from

rateLimitPerSecond().notice: the rate per second for this contract

rateLimitedMinter().notice: Rate Limited Minter contract that will be called when VOLT needs to be minted

readOracle().notice: the peg price of the referenced oracle

redeem(address,uint256,uint256).notice: function to redeem VOLT for an underlying asset We do not burn VOLT; this allows the contract's balance of VOLT to be used before the buffer is used In practice, this helps prevent artificial cycling of mint-burn cycles and prevents DOS attacks. This function will deplete the buffer based on the amount of VOLT that is being redeemed.

redeemFeeBasisPoints().notice: the fee in basis points for buying the asset for VOLT

redeemPaused().notice: boolean switch that indicates whether redeeming is paused

setContractAdminRole(bytes32).notice: sets a new admin role for this contract

setDoInvert(bool).notice: sets the flag for whether to invert or not

setGlobalRateLimitedMinter(address).notice: set the target to call for VOLT minting

setMintFee(uint256).notice: set the mint fee vs oracle price in basis point terms

setPCVDeposit(address).notice: set the target for sending all PCV

setRateLimitPerSecond(uint256).notice: set the rate limit per second

setRedeemFee(uint256).notice: set the redemption fee vs oracle price in basis point terms

underlyingToken().notice: the token this PSM will exchange for VOLT Must be a stable token pegged to $1

unpauseMint().notice: set secondary pausable methods to unpaused

unpauseRedeem().notice: set secondary pausable methods to unpaused

vcon().notice: address of the Tribe contract referenced by Core

volt().notice: address of the Fei contract referenced by Core

documentation.text: @notice the fee in basis points for selling an asset into VOLT
@notice the fee in basis points for buying the asset for VOLT
@notice the PCV deposit target to deposit and withdraw from

@notice the token this PSM will exchange for VOLT
 Must be a stable token pegged to $1
@notice Rate Limited Minter contract that will be called when VOLT needs to be minted

@notice the max mint and redeem fee in basis points
 Governance cannot change the maximum fee
@notice boolean switch that indicates whether redeeming is paused
@notice boolean switch that indicates whether minting is paused
@notice modifier that allows execution when redemptions are not paused
@notice modifier that allows execution when minting is not paused
@notice set secondary pausable methods to paused
@notice set secondary pausable methods to unpaused
@notice set secondary pausable methods to paused
@notice set secondary pausable methods to unpaused

@notice set the mint fee vs oracle price in basis point terms
 @param newMintFeeBasisPoints the new fee in basis points for minting

@notice set the redemption fee vs oracle price in basis point terms
 @param newRedeemFeeBasisPoints the new fee in basis points for redemptions

@notice set the target for sending all PCV
 @param newTarget new PCV Deposit target for this PSM
